text:
_Not sure if get it right, but:_
 <@U01V27H2P0F> Programmable e-mails are available in beta. Currently, properties can be obtained as token or CRM object. However, the safety restrictions are only allow manual but not contact based auto e-mails. Expression test for token do not currently work in programmable e-mails. For CRM objects they work. But as I said, user properties are not available in automated e-mail.

Maybe you can generate a uniq property value in a workflow and create with it a custom button that use the token syntax to append that property to your Url.

Hey - is there any way in a HUBL + HTML template to build an editable section without using a module? For instance if I just needed to insert a single editable field for preview text, could that be inserted directly in the main template or does it have to be it's own module?
Hello <@U027Z0MK4RY>, there is, it is called a hubl tag and you can find a bunch of them <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags|right here in this link>.
<@U01D95STUS3> - thanks I'm taking a look now
Hmm, actually I'm not seeing the field in the editor

This is my code:

```  <div style="display:none;font-size:1px;color:#ffffff;line-height:1px;max-height:0px;max-width:0px;opacity:0;overflow:hidden;"> {% text "preview_text" label="Preview Text", value="Insert preview text here / Insert preview text here / Insert preview text here / Insert preview text here /" %} </div>```
Shouldn't I get a field in the editor with the label `Preview Text`?
yes you should and you are but it is in a div with `display:none`  sto it is hidden from the doc flow
Hmm, so the editor field gets hidden as well?
I tried removing the display none and the field still doesn't show up in the editor, are you sure these can be used in emails?
make sure you don't have any other tags or modules with the same id of `preview_text`
there is a `preview_text`  tag by default in the email template, you should either get rid of it or rename your tag to something like `preview_text_two`
